overlayLatLonGrid

public void overlayLatLonGrid(java.awt.Color color,
                              int ImageEdgeWidth,
                              int GridSpacing,
                              double PlotInterval,
                              int LabelFontSize)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
This function overlays a Latitude/Longitude grid on the projected image and adds labels for the Latitude, Longitude grids on the top/left edges. Note that it changes the dimensions of the final image because it add edges to allow the labels to be drawn

Parameters:
color - color of the grids (they would be dashed lines)
ImageEdgeWidth - the width of the edge (in pixels) around the projected image. The edge is used to write the labels. Must be >=40. A good value is 40.0
GridSpacing - lat/lon lines will be drawn every 'GridSpacing'th degree. A good value is 10
PlotInterval - lat/lon segments will be drawn every 'PlotInterval'th degree. A good value is 0.2
LabelFontSize - Font size of the grid labels
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

concatLegend

public void concatLegend(ValueMapper valueMapper,
                         java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> markers,
                         java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> markerValues,
                         java.lang.String legend,
                         int leght,
                         int ImageEdgeWidth,
                         int LabelFontSize)
This function concatenates a legend subimage at the bottom of the primary image. Do not call when you are creating non-colormapped images (for example true color images with 3 bands)

Parameters:
valueMapper - The valuemapper
markers -
markerValues -
legend -

fillImage2

public void fillImage2()
fillImage.

removeNoise

public void removeNoise(int noisenbd)
This function will remove noise. A pixel is noise if it is maximum in the nbd. Use this function only if required. Exercise caution because it may remove valid pixels.

Parameters:
noisenbd - defines the neighborhood size for purposes of noise removal

sharpenImage

public void sharpenImage()
This function sharpens the image using the sharpening kernel

convolveImage

public void convolveImage()
This function convolves the image using a kernel. It uses a 5*5 equal-weight kernel. The function can be later extended by having the size of the kernel and the weights as function arguments

meanFilter

public void meanFilter(int nbd_size)
This function applies a mean filter on the image. Only applicable for colormapped images (i.e. not rgb).

Parameters:
nbd_size - is the size of the window surrounding the pixel on which the mean filter is applied

fillImage3

public void fillImage3()

bi - is the BufferedImage object to be copied
Returns:
copied BufferedImage

fillImage_InvDist

public void fillImage_InvDist(int npixels,
                              int distanceToSearch)
Does image filling using distance weighted interpolation

Parameters:
npixels - is the number of neighborhood pixels to use to do the interpolation
distanceToSearch - is the maximum nbd search area (until 'npixels' is obtained)

invDistanceWeightedRGB

private int invDistanceWeightedRGB(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   java.awt.image.BufferedImage mask,
                                   java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                   int npixels,
                                   int distanceToSearch)
This function does inverse distance wighted interpolation for a particular pixel

Parameters:
x - is the x-coordinate of the pixel to be interpolated
y - is the y-coordinate of the pixel to be interpolated
mask - is the mask image. It contains information about the location of the actual pixels (i.e. before any interpolation)
image - is the image to be filled
npixels - is the number of pixels to use for the interpolation
distanceToSearch - is the maximum nbd search area (until 'npixels' is obtained)
Returns:
